caption: This place has good flavors. Love the ambiance. Very cute and cozy. The service was amazing. We had the chicken sliders and Mumbai Mariachi bowl. Both were heavenly.The limonina drink was very refreshing. will be back soon.

We were very happy with our meal at this restaurant the food was delicious we had a wonderful Bronzino and a very very good pasta dish. I would recommend it it’s not extremely high price but it’s a very nice restaurant very comfortable too. Then the wait staff is excellent as well
Great food and staff. Pizzas were amazing. Steak tartar was delicious.
Excellent location for Sunday brunch.  The French toast was outstanding!

If I were more of a connaiseur, i would probably give it 5 stars. As it is, i found the food tasty and rich, the prices resonable considering, and the service friendly and efficient. Nice ambience, as well. Now that i think about it, it should have been 5.
Good food. Friendly staff.

Nice atmosphere. Lively yet intimate. We were there on Valentine's day, and service was attentive but main course was delayed a bit coming out.  The burrata and venison were the highlights for me. Risotto was a little undercooked. All and all...very positive experience.
Excelent service!! Good food!!
The food is great and the atmosphere is lovely
Wonderful food, excellent decoration, great service - overall it’s a memorable dining experience. Highly recommended, would definitely come again :)

Went here for a mother/daughter lunch date early on a Saturday. Restaurant was quiet but service was exceptional. Both the maître d' and waiter Oscar were very cordial, we were well attended without feeling crowded. The food here is incredible! We did apps with prosecco to start with and then split the duck egg raviolo and every bite was mouth watering. Highly recommend the gelato to finish! We will be back!

Excellent restaurant. We had cappelletti di zucca, bucatini cacio e pepe, grilled calamari and brussel sprouts and everything was superb. The attention Eduardo gave us was wonderful as well, and they even brought us a courtesy dessert

A nice, classy atmosphere, in a good location for tourists, with reasonable prices and good service. Portions slightly small, but dishes were tasty. A bit noisy in the bar area, but, overall, very solid & a pleasant experience!
Food was good but it lacked something... ambiance maybe? Could be because it was a weekday lunch right after Christmas.
(Translated by Google) Rustic Italian restaurant It was delicious. I'd like to try the oven pizza. The Washington Post is nearby.  (Original) 소소한 이탈리아 식당 맛있었습니다. 화덕 피자도 먹어보고싶네요. 워싱턴 포스트가 근처에 있습니다.
Went on a quiet Sunday afternoon. The host stand, bar, and wait staff were all so nice. Food was wonderfully flavored, the house-made bread was thick and tart and delicious.
It is ok but not as good as i expected.

(Translated by Google) Excellent Italian-inspired restaurant attached to the Hamilton Hotel. We are fortunate to have dinner there on a weekday evening and on New Years Eve. The setting is neat and welcoming; the service is impeccable. The cuisine is made with fresh products and the pizza is prepared on site and baked visible from your table! Definitely to visit!  (Original) Excellent restaurant d'inspiration italienne adossé à l'hôtel Hamilton.  Nous avons la chance d'y dîner un soir de semaine et pour le réveillon du 31 . Le cadre est soigné et l'accueil ; le service est impeccable. La cuisine est faites avec des produits frais et la pizza est préparée sur place et cuit au four visible de votre table ! A visiter assurément !

(Translated by Google) Very welcoming place and good food! We spent New Year's Eve dinner in this restaurant, ordering pumpkin tortelloni and bucatini cacio e pepe really tasty! Even very tasty bread! For tiramisu dessert that if I have to be honest it did not drive me crazy (there were no ladyfingers or biscuits inside, rather fortified and a little expensive). Very nice staff and fast service!  (Original) Locale molto accogliente e buon cibo! Abbiamo passato la cena di capodanno in questo ristorante, ordinando  tortelloni alla zucca e bucatini cacio e pepe veramente gustosi! Anche il pane molto saporito! Per dolce del tiramisù che se devo essere onesta non mi ha fatto impazzire (non vi erano savoiardi o biscotti all’interno,piuttosto liquoroso e un pochetto expensive). Il personale molto gentile e il servizio veloce!

Gnocchi with duck, Burratta cheese salad with beets, small fresh mushroom pizza and great brussel sprouts are a sampling of some of the interesting dishes. We ate Christmas dinner here and loved the food.

Hostess has WAY too much time in hand. She was showing something on her phones to 3 waiters. Had to get the pepper off the main table because the waiters were too busy. The bartender took care of us (African-American guy), he was really nice.
World class brunch and pasta dishes. Top notch service and a highly recommended experience.
Loved the brussel sprouts!!
Really enjoyed the mushroom pizza and happy hour prices are great.  Awesome service too. Really enjoyed this experience! 😁

Great upscale Italian restaurant. We went here to have lunch during Christmas week. The prefix lunch menu is amazing and amazingly not pricy at all. You can see and taste that each dish contains a lot of thought and attention. I highly recommend.

A very clean, classy, upscale restaurant. Nice presentation of food. I got the salmon and didn't think I was going to like the rest of the toppings that came on the plate but I ended up eating every last bite.
(Translated by Google) Good customer service ...  (Original) Buena atencio alos clientes ...
Great place for happy hour and pizza!
Ask for Ekesh he is the best
Great food. Tiny portions

Had a great time for lunch here! Oscar our serving was amazing. Very attentive to our needs and provided excellent customer service . Plus the food presentation was beautiful and it was delicious! Would definitly go back again
Delicious lemony salty garlicky clam linguini. The bread is fantastic. The boar ragu was great as well.
Server could have been more attentive, food was great, noisy resturant, and we had late reservations. My fish ossobucco was not really ossobucco cut, I was served the tail portion of the fish.
They do birthdays well here! The waiter named Isaac was very sweet to my Mom and I. We got the ricotta and 2 pastas - perfect for 2 people.

I had by far the best meal I have ever had in D.C.—one of the best dinners of my life!—here with two friends and we just could not believe how wonderful everything was: the autumnal burrata plate with beets and surprising, delicious radicchio and red onion marmalade, the fresh, perfect salad, an exceptional wild mushroom pizza cooked in their really special and actually beautiful pizza oven. The pastas were indescribably delicious.  And the restaurant is very pretty and modern and sophisticated in its decor, and it was a nice treat for us to sit on the outside patio on a warm fall night. The servers were gracious and helpful and the wine choices were excellent. I WISH this restaurant was in NYC so I could go back and try everything on the menu. Even the charred cabbage side was yummy beyond belief. But most of all, each dish had so many thoughtful flavor combinations and exquisitely prepared elements within, the kind of things that would take an entire day  to prepare just the components of a salad alone, and which make for a level of nuance and flavor that my friends and I were as impressed as we could ever remember being by a chef. Bring this restaurant to New York!!!
A special place with good people
Sunday brunch was wonderful and our server Oscar was fantastic.  I highly recommend and we will be back.
This is an interesting place, good tasty food but noisy as hell. I guess it adds charm to the place. Not cheap. But this is the heart of Washington

Restaurant beautifully appointed.  Felt clean, fresh, airy and structured at the same time with marble like and wood with airy lighting throughout.  Went during happy hour and the cocktail was Good but not all ingredients Were indicated on The menu making it a surprise Drink mixture that was unexpected based on what I thought I was getting.  The menu is not a traditional Italian...lots of different ingredients.  Ordered a pizza which I don’t remember if it indicated wheat type crust or a few of the ingredients that were on the pizza.  Would recommend if allergic to anything to ASK.  I would go again but it is not something from what I selected that I would crave.  I was full and price was reasonable...just spent more time saying it was interesting Vs something I enjoyed.
Had a trade association networking event here.   Good drinks,  yummy pizzas and crostini appetizers.  The patio is nice even in rainy weather because it is covered.
Loved this place! Had cocktails there and the bartender was a gem!
Everything tasted wonderful!  My bucatini cacio e pepe was especially delicious, and reminded me of dining in Italy.

Our server London was amazing.  Kind, knowledgeable, helpful, attentive and drop dead gorgeous Ahmed is hands down the best manager in DC.  His knowledge of the menu, wine list and spirits is incredible.  He is so awesome with clients, he should teach a class.
Overpriced, food just okay
Linguini is great and so is everything else

The food was great for brunch but the service was awful. I was with 11 people and it took 1.5 hours to get our food. They also didn't have any vegan brunch options. My cousin asked to get a salad with no cheese but they brought out a salad with cheese. Thankfully they comped it.  The buratta dish was A++ The french toast was delicious The baked eggs primavera was also quite tasty  Everyone else seemed happy with their dishes but they didn't feel compelled about coming back again. If their service improves I would come back again for brunch.

This restaurant feels new and fresh.  The owners did not skimp on the design and it has a huge bar for solo visitors who do not want to eat at a table.  The food offerings were solid and the service was pleasant and efficient.  Perhaps what was missing was a stand out dish or a reason “I just have to go here” but hopefully this place will capitalize on its momentum.

Enzo is a top notch, spunky server you must request. Via Sophia is bar none the best restaurant I’ve dined in ages. From the quail appetizer to the unbelievable salad, to the linguini, VS is a don’t miss restaurant.
Wonderful food and the service it’s the best I ever had!

Via Sophia is the newly renovated restaurant inside the historic Hamilton Hotel at 14th and K Street NW.  It's a large space with two dining rooms, a bar, and outdoor patio seating. There's a wood-fired oven for pizzas in the back.  The menu includes breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I went for breakfast and ordered an iced latte and ricotta pancakes. The pancakes were so creamy and superbly made.  I'd go back!
Food, Atmosphere, and Service I give 5 stars. Made reservations for dinner here on the fourth of July and the pizza here was amazing  very close to what I had when I was in Florence taste wise.

The food and drink were spectacular but the front of the restaurant and bar need more training. What I can only assume was the general manager was pretty rude when I pointed out that our glasses smelled. Having worked in fine dining this indicates a dishwasher needs to have its filter and guts deep cleaned. Further, the bartender needs training in available whiskeys and spirits. I came with a whiskey ambassador and we were given the wrong brand of whiskey; very cringey.

Delicious wood-fired Neapolitan pizza! So glad Hamilton replaced its 14th & K restaurant with modern Italian. The menu at the restaurant is a bit different from what's posted on the website - check out DC Eater for the latest menu. The Italian food is truly authentic and the brainchild of a Fiola Mare alum.  The Italian happy hour "Apertivo" is decent with a pizza/wine deal and few dollars off the pizza along with some cured meats as well as a couple of cocktails for $8, which aren't offered on the Dinner menu. The refreshing "Sorriento" cocktail during Apertivo with vodka, limoncello, and sparkling wine packs a punch!  The complementary warm and fluffy house-baked semolina loaf is divine, definitely ask for it! We did and came in handy for the burrata!  The luscious glob of creamy Burrata with grilled country bread and marinated veggies in olive oil and pesto was tasty. I watched my friend's boyfriend relish in delight as he mopped up the last drop of oil sparing no crumbs with the complementary bread.  The Margherita pizza was heavenly with pillowy soft charred crust cooked all the way through to the bottom with tomato sauce,  fresh buffalo mozzarella topped with basil. It definitely hit the spot!  Similar to the sweet red bubbly wine Lambrusco, the "Cantine Federiciane Gragnano" had a hint of sweetness and paired well with the Margherita pizza.  Need to go to the bathroom? Push open the unmarked door in the wooden panel (sadly it's not a speakeasy - I was fooled too!).  Don't worry there's a new speakeasy in the lobby. Will be pushing open the blank white wall for some late night cocktails at "Society" next time!  Excited to come back and try the pasta and Tiramisu, as well as the craft cocktails at Society.
Very good food, the guy who brings the food is very friendly and I was impressed to see how to clean the fish that tasted delicious I will go back again

Not even sure where to begin. I would give less, but the food was good so giving 2 stars. 1. Reserve outside patio, confirm 2x’s, turns out you can not reserve the patio area. 2. Got seated, for a table of 8, I arrive early (5:40pm) with someone else, received, 2 regular menus & 2 happy hour menus (2 drinks menus where in the table already). Turns out in the dinning area, you are not allowed to order from the happy menu . 3.  Team arrived, no menus provided, had to get up and retrieve menus to everyone. 4. Try to order from happy hr menu, was informed I am not allowed and the menus were taken away from me. 5.  order some starters around 6:30pm from regular menu, team places their drinks. Some requested Diet Coke & Mountain Dew, received Pepsi. No explanation or information was received about no coke products available (which would have been 100% understandable) 5a. Some members try to say they didn’t order that to waiter, waiter seemed confused, “this is soda, you want rum?”- ah, no? 6. 7pm, starters came out (remember, I’ve been here since 5:40pm) 7. We order our mains, at that time manager came up and ask how our experience has been? team stayed quiet & just smiled. We were trying to be polite. So I decided to say something. I think I mention 1 & 6 and gave me his card and ran off! 8. He sends his staff with Prosecco...? — no one likes that so we try to say no, thank you & received the weirdest confused look ever, sorry? 9. Server got changed to someone else and were left alone. 10. 7:40-ish main dishes came out, I’ve been here since 5:40 (2hrs have passed now) 11. We ate ( food was good!) and ask for the check so we can just leave and forget this moment. 12. Service team started to plate us for desert...? Again we try to say no thank you, we just want to leave. Servers insisted and we got played. 13. One of my members from the team got up and spoke with the manager to explain that we appreciate the effort he Is trying to do, but we really don’t need desert and if we could just pay so we can leave. 14. Acouple of minutes later, about 4 deserts came out, like seriously? We just said, thank you for trying but we just want to leave. Meanwhile, one of my members try to just pay (that was a struggle on its own)  We just literally got up after we confirm with the manager that we paid, and left. This has been one of the worst experiences in my life. It’s a real shame since the location seems nice and the food is good. I could mention what I would have done if I was the manager, but will not. To each their own.

After a long couple of days of travel, we arrived for a two night stay at the Hamilton.  Being that Via Sophia is just an elevator ride away, we decided to forgo looking around downtown for dinner, and eat here with no real expectation other than convenience to our location.  However, after what my wife and I agree was the best steak dinner we’ve had, I wish I had found Via Sophia in a culinary magazine and built an expectation worthy of our experience.  Our having stumbled into such a great meal did the chef and waiter a disservice, as their efforts were worth a planned visit.  We ordered a bottle of Cab Sav, a meat and cheese plate as an appetizer, and the steak dinner for two.  We were given a salad as compliments of the chef, and it was an extraordinarily crafted summer blend.  Saying “Thank you” to the accommodating staff for providing the best meal we’ve ever enjoyed in DC simply isn’t enough.

The restaurant was absolutely beautiful! The staff were all so friendly and always made sure we had everything we needed. I loved the scallop appetizer and for the main course, the salmon was amazing. The Spring Harvest salad was so fresh, every strawberry was so sweet and all the greens were nice and crisp. The food was super delicious, it was so flavorful and the presentation was a 10/10. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the caring staff, the experience left me in a delighted mood!

Wonderful experience. Located conveniently downtown and has a beautiful patio area. Beautiful decor and great ambiance. Food was delicious! I highly recommend the charcuterie, quail, eggplant, hamacha, black bass and gnocchi! The dishes were flavorful and beautifully plated. Service was also amazing. Will definitely be coming back with guests!
